channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 姜黄正在杀人。发展中国家--尤其是印度--应该学习孟加拉国公开、务实的尝试，防止这种情况发生👇。
item.description:
Turmeric is killing people. Developing countries—especially India—should learn from Bangladesh’s open, pragmatic attempts to prevent this from happening https://t.co/VL4vGJGzTf 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 最新研究显示，全球最便宜的 20 座城市中有 9 座位于亚洲。但亚洲大陆也有一些世界上最昂贵的大都市👇。
item.description:
Nine of the world’s 20 cheapest cities are in Asia, according to new research. But the continent is also home to some of the world’s most exorbitant metropolises https://t.co/meAGqkGkmG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 巴基斯坦军队可能已经逃脱了最近一次选举抢劫。但它能继续控制局面吗？有两个理由让人认为该国的将军们可能会陷入困境： 兰长
item.description:
Pakistan’s army may have gotten away with its latest election heist. But can it maintain control? There are two reasons to think the country’s generals could struggle: https://t.co/LNvTZIRaDx

Illustration: Lan Truong pic.twitter.com/7dzAmn9bIa

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 詹姆斯-布拉德利（James Bradley）摇下车窗迎接一名边防人员，一只巡逻犬在他的拖车周围盘旋。他试图平复自己的情绪。100 名无证移民被装在后面。
item.description:
James Bradley rolled down his window for a border agent, as a patrol dog circled his trailer. He tried to calm his nerves. A hundred undocumented migrants were loaded in the back.

1843 magazine explores what drives truckers to become people smugglers
https://t.co/AAvTAG5Ji8

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 私募股权经理退出投资的可能途径，如将公司上市或出售给另一家公司，几乎都被切断了。
item.description:
Possible paths for private-equity managers to exit investments, such as taking a firm public or selling it to another company, have been all but shut off.

The slump might prove more damaging than previous ones, for a couple of reasons https://t.co/gTcLA7adHu 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 租房便宜还是买房便宜？我们的分析显示了近年来美国大部分地区买房和租房的相对成本是如何被颠覆的👇。
item.description:
Is it cheaper to rent or buy property? Our analysis shows how the relative costs of buying and renting have been upended throughout much of America in recent years https://t.co/gnDkN0zHgj 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 在中国大部分地区深陷房地产危机、消费需求疲软的情况下，出人意料的强劲出口和对美国经济衰退的担忧逐渐减弱，使宁波成为中国最乐观的城市之一 👇 。
item.description:
With much of the country mired in a property crisis and suffering from weak consumer demand, surprisingly strong exports and fading fears of a recession in America have combined to make Ningbo one of China’s most optimistic cities https://t.co/pGUhXotUsr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 大多数服用抗抑郁药物的人并不需要这种药物。找出真正需要抗抑郁药的人，并让其他人摆脱这种药物👇。
item.description:
Most people on antidepressants don’t need them. Identify those who really do—and wean other people off them https://t.co/vBuszG9ozF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: "相当聪明的人 "一直预测 "美国经济注定会放缓，但经济却一直在蒸蒸日上"。@s_rabinovitch 在 "制衡 "节目中解释了原因 🎧
item.description:
“Quite smart people” have been predicting that “America is destined for a slowdown, and yet the economy just keeps steaming on.” @s_rabinovitch explains why, on “Checks and Balance” https://t.co/j5V9Hr9tAD 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 19, 2024

item.title: 随着精神疾病的增加，越来越多的科学家正在研究营养如何影响大脑。食物影响心理，也影响身体 👇
item.description:
With mental-health disorders rising, a growing number of scientists are investigating how nutrition influences the brain. Food affects the mind, as well as the body https://t.co/SeFK5r1uCZ 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 市场给了年轻人一手烂牌。他们可以打得更好。他们应该这样投资 👇
item.description:
Markets have dealt young people a bad hand. They could be playing it better. This is how they should invest https://t.co/T60lCkMVhs 👇

item.title: 中国、俄罗斯和伊朗正在建立更紧密的关系。反西方轴心会构成多大的经济威胁？ 👇
item.description:
China, Russia and Iran are forging closer ties. How much of an economic threat does the anti-Western axis pose? https://t.co/7lUPhCXWFt 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 在戏剧《莱西斯特拉塔》中，希腊交战国的妇女拒绝与情人做爱，以抗议正在进行的战争。两千多年后，纽约市外的极端东正教犹太妇女也在进行类似的罢工，但原因另当别论
item.description:
In the play “Lysistrata”, the women of warring Greek states deny their lovers sex in protest against an ongoing war. More than two millennia later ultra-­Orthodox Jewish women outside New York City are carrying out a similar strike, but for another reason https://t.co/8U1nbFESHP pic.twitter.com/vDadSEI2zc

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 美国经济的好日子还能继续吗？尽管经济增长具有显著的韧性，通胀率也有所下降，但仍未实现众所周知的软着陆👇。
item.description:
Can the good times roll on for America’s economy? Although growth has been remark­ably resilient and inflation has fallen, it has not yet quite pulled off the proverbial soft landing https://t.co/18uktaIjB5 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 试管婴儿让大多数妇女失望了。根本问题在于，人们对生育能力的了解仍然少得令人震惊。但新的研究为革命带来了希望 👇。
item.description:
IVF is failing most women. The fundamental problem is that fertility is still shockingly poorly understood. But new research holds out hope of a revolution https://t.co/pF6QMGFCFN 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 荷兰一座小城的博览会是了解艺术世界的窗口。社交媒体以及审美和室内设计的变化，改变了什么才是卖点👇。
item.description:
A fair in a small Dutch city is a window on the art world. Social media, as well as changes in aesthetics and interior design, have changed what sells https://t.co/Bdl6sbo7iX 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 美国、英国、欧盟和乌克兰已宣布俄罗斯总统选举结果不合法。我们解释了为什么民主政府在应对国外不正当选举时几乎没有好的选择👇。
item.description:
America, Britain, the EU and Ukraine have declared the result of Russia’s presidential vote illegitimate.

We explain why democratic governments have few good options when it comes to responding to dodgy elections abroad https://t.co/RpnJ9DaEH1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 性问题被认为是造成五分之一到一半离婚的原因。减少这一数字将使许多成人和儿童免于痛苦和贫困👇。
item.description:
Sexual issues are thought to contribute to between a ﬁfth and half of all divorces. Reducing that number would spare many adults and children from misery and impoverishment https://t.co/rdk4yYvYYh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 美国希望在以色列建立新的领导层，但政治变革的机制却充满变数。在最有可能发生的情况下，他们有可能面临三个月的危险过渡期👇。
item.description:
America wants new leadership in Israel, but the mechanics of a political change are fraught.

In the most likely scenario they open up the possibility of a dangerous three-month transition period https://t.co/LDWNIFW7gj 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 2010 年代，反腐浪潮席卷整个拉丁美洲。在巴西，Lava Jato 是最著名的活动之一。十年过去了，人们对腐败的看法却日益恶化：
item.description:
A wave of anti-corruption activity swept across Latin America in the 2010s. In Brazil, Lava Jato was one of the most famous. Ten years on, perceptions of corruption are worsening: https://t.co/gV1UTjFKmS pic.twitter.com/30HoCP4JiR

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024

item.title: 在 ChatGPT 时代，欧洲的经济水平与磁带时代相同。这种对比既比看起来更糟糕，也比看起来更好：
item.description:
Europe’s economy is at the same level in the age of ChatGPT as it was at the time of cassette tapes. That comparison is both worse and better than it looks: https://t.co/mXQOfAQCk9 pic.twitter.com/ZMu3lbSmwo

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 18, 2024
